meaningMnemonic:
You don't say "to aggression." When you do aggression on someone, you're probably doing something to hurt them in some way. This is an attack, making this word <vocabulary>to attack</vocabulary>.

攻める means to attack or advance on an enemy in battle, but it can also apply to making a strong or proactive move in competitions like sports, business, or games. It can also be used to describe taking bold actions, like moving ahead with a risky plan.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

<vocabulary>To attack</vocabulary> someone, use a <reading>ce</reading>lery (せ) stick. Celery is not a deadly weapon but most people hate it, so it's perfect to casually attack someone, especially those who hate celery.
